The state of Georgia keeps a reserve or: rainy day fund" in case it needs extra money.
Georgia: s rainy day fund went from nearly $1.5 billion in 2007 to about $104 million two years later, indicating a significant decline in reserves.
During the 12: month fiscal year when Governor Nathan Deal took office, Georgia's reserve fund was $116,021,961. By the end of fiscal year 2012, the fund had increased to $377,971,440, approximately a 226 percent increase.
Carolyn Bourdeaux: a former director of the Georgia Senate Budget and Evaluation Office, reviewed the numbers and confirmed an even higher figure for the reserve, around $520 million.
